column1: 7499293,s0,T1,T2,Molecular cloning of ,NIPP-1,", a ",nuclear inhibitor of protein phosphatase-1,", reveals homology with polypeptides involved in RNA processing.

,Not_a_complex
7499293,s1,T3,T13,,NIPP-1, was originally isolated as a potent and specific nuclear inhibitory polypeptide (16-18 kDa) of ,protein phosphatase-1,.,Not_a_complex
7499293,s3,T14,T15,The bacterially expressed central third of NIPP-1 completely inhibited the type-1 catalytic subunit, but displayed a reduced inhibitory potency after phosphorylation by ",protein kinase A, and ,casein kinase 2,.,Not_a_complex

7499293,s4,T6,T7,Translation of ,NIPP-1, mRNA in reticulocyte lysates resulted in the accumulation of both intact ,NIPP-1, and a smaller polypeptide generated by alternative initiation at the codon corresponding to Met143.,Not_a_complex

7499293,s5,T8,T9,A data base search showed that the COOH terminus of ,NIPP-1, is nearly identical to the human ,ard-1," protein (13 kDa), which has been implicated in RNA processing (Wang, M., and Cohen, S. N. (1994) Proc.",Not_a_complex
7499293,s10,T10,T11,Comparison of the cDNAs encoding ,ard-1, and ,NIPP-1, suggests that their mRNAs are generated by alternative splicing of the same pre-mRNA.,Not_a_complex
